text:
Are many here making money off predictable market dynamics/behavioural trends as opposed to modelling and fundamentals?
I may be wildly off but It seems the majority of the big fish here seem to do it on modelling/ml/statistical analysis rather than behavioural things is this true or am I off the mark?

text:
This got me thinking, anyone analysed the pnl of retried place requests :thinking_face: 

<https://x.com/beatzxbt/status/1751657347317960743?s=61&t=0cfWhtKwsUCmEetOYaYXCQ|https://x.com/beatzxbt/status/1751657347317960743?s=61&t=0cfWhtKwsUCmEetOYaYXCQ>

attachments.text:
for the HFT guys, do you bother retrying failed requests often?

im finding it hard to justify retrying potentially 3 times, as in events that tend to cause these errors (high vol), by the time i send the request ill need to change the order anyway
attachments.title: BeatzXBT (@BeatzXBT) on X

elements.text: This got me thinking, anyone analysed the pnl of retried place requests

text: Do you need to retry a lot? I don't even track my bet placement failure rate

text: I guess this a bigger problem for those who have BPE turned off?

text: I guess it depends which way the wind is blowing on the betfair servers, I have just always assumed a user would want the retry

text: For those going based of price action, I can see why they might. If based on fundamentals, the strategy should retry on its own without being explicitly told to do so

text: Is BPE on or off by default?

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

elements.text: Is BPE on or off by default?

text: On, the ability to turn off was due to regulation

elements.text: On, the ability to turn off was due to regulation

text: I assume you would just check the condition again and retry if it’s still true, rather than retrying for the sake of it

elements.text: I assume you would just check the condition again and retry if
still true, rather than retrying for the sake of it

text: That comes at a huge cost in time and complication

elements.text: That comes at a huge cost in time and complication

text: Does it? I’d assume if you’ve already done the round trip to hear a place order failed then super latency sensitive stuff would have gone already, otherwise unless you’re taking a lot of time to process it should be similar latency wise to just resubmitting a failed order, but you wouldn’t resubmit if the condition had changed. If you’re doing heavy calculations with latency sensitivity I’d assume you’d need to offload to another thread and cache the results anyway, and just do a quick check of e.g price > X, so don’t see how it’d be different. Not sure what context you’re talking about though

text:
My initial point was regarding latency sensitive strategies and it’s something I have never really though about / ignored.

Regarding the cost I guess it’s a case of handling the retry and it’s logic, it’s just another complication and if it’s not latency sensitive surely just a retry is the simple option as it’s only been ~500-1000ms

something I have never really though about / ignored.

a case of handling the retry and
not latency sensitive surely just a retry is the simple option as

text:
Makes sense, and yeah shouldn’t matter either way if not latency sensitive.

I think generally I try to keep trading code stateless so the logic by default would just be to ignore failed orders and only retry if conditions are still true. Target position = (calculation)… trade while position < target position. Or target position at price level = (calculation) and the same

elements.text:
matter either way if not latency sensitive.

text:
As someone on here recently stated, most people who try to trade on Betfair will fail even if they have great credentials.

And I've seen plenty of failures from both fundamental and technical approaches. A user will need to have their own take of whatever material they read.

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc
